resources.string: jAlcoMeter is a tool for monitoring your drinking habits. If you drink, use jAlcoMeter!
Remove all drinks from this day
Add a drink to this day

This application is meant for your amusement, and I do not guarantee that the alcohol levels shown in the application have anything to do with the actual reality. I shall in no event be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or exemplary damages caused by the use of this application or by the consumption of alcohol accompanying the use of this application. This application must not be used in a competitory fashion, especially when you have consumed said alcohol. 

I am not responsible for the possible intoxication of the users of this application, nor from the consequental hangover. Neither am I responsible for the possible accidents occurring before, during, or after the use of this application. I do not make any guarantees for the preservation of the data collected by jAlcoMeter; after all, software bugs have been known to occur. 

I do guarantee, however, that all the data collected by jAlcoMeter stays in your phone - it is never transmitted anywhere. The permissions required by the application are only used for storing the data backups on your phone storage. 

Please remember that the blood alcohol level shown by this application is based on calculated approximations that in turn are based on the values given by you, the user; and therefore may or may not be close to the actual reality. In no event do I guarantee that you are capable of driving a car, even if the application says that this might be the case.
Then read the text again until you do…
Please read the text and state your understanding of it!
You have previously purchased a license for jAlcoMeter. Thank you for your support!

The image icons used in jAlcoMeter have been taken from the Flaticon icon library (http://www.flaticon.com/), and the alcohol meter image was made by Anu Haapasalo. UI icons are standard icons from Google\'s Material Design icon set. The Flaticon icons are licensed under the Creative Commons BY 3.0 license, and have been made by these authors: Freepik (http://www.freepik.com), Roundicons (https://www.flaticon.com/authors/roundicons), Vectors Market (https://www.flaticon.com/authors/vectors-market), and Papedesign (https://www.flaticon.com/authors/papedesign). Many thanks to the authors! For more info on licenses and credits, check the source code.

jAlcoMeter is hosted in GitHub at https://github.com/thaapasa/jalkametri-android and the source codes can be freely downloaded from there. The project is licensed under the MIT license. \n\nIf you wish to develop a similar application, feel free to use the sources.
Are you sure you want to reset the drink library to the defaults?
Are you sure you want to delete all drinks from this day?
Are you sure you want to delete this drink category (including all its drinks)?
Are you sure you wish to delete this drink, alongside with all its sizes?
You are probably able to drive.
You may be able to drive. You may be sober after %1$s (at %2$s).
You are definitely not in any condition to drive a car! You may be able to drive after %1$s (at %2$s), and you may be sober after %3$s (at %4$s).
Add some favorites here from the application menu.
Error: the drink has not been set
Error: the drink size has not been set
The selected language. Restart jAlcoMeter to update all shown strings.
Your weight (in kilograms). The blood alcohol level is calculated based on this.
On which day does your week start?
Your gender affects the alcohol burning speed.
The blood alcohol level limit for driving a car, per mille. This on 0.5 in Finland.
The maximum per mille count shown by the alcohol meter gauge.
Drinks drunk before this time (usually in the morning) are registered for the previous day, so that you can continue drinking past midnight.
How much alcohol is there in a standard drink (in grams)? Listed are common values used in several countries. One standard drink is regarded as one portion in jAlcoMeter.
Recalculating portions in the history database, please wait…
You can backup jAlcoMeter data, and restore them later on. You can, for example, move your drinking history to another phone via this functionality
Backup service is not available. The service requires an SD card, and the card must be mounted to the phone (not mounted as an USB drive to a computer).
Creating a backup of the database…
Are you sure you wish to restore this backup? Restoring the backup will overwrite your current data!

Data backup copies the application\'s database file into the SD card under a new name, and restoration copies the database file back. All backups are retained. If the application version has changed in between backup and restore, this may cause problems! To be safe, create a new backup before restoring old backup data.
There are no data backups available

This is the help page for jAlcoMeter. You can access help pages from the question mark icon and/or from the options menu. 

Use the main menu to mark when you consume a drink, to browse your drinking history and to see some statistics. Remember to check the settings (accessed via the options menu) to set your language, gender and weight. 

Click the car image to check your driving condition, and to obtain an estimate on how long it will take for the alcohol to leave your body. 

You can also add favorites that can be quickly accessed from the main screen via the options menu. 

There is also a jAlcoMeter widget that you can add to your home screen. The widget shows your current BAC and the first three of your favorite drinks for instant access from the home screen.
This page shows information about the jAlcoMeter software.

This is a drink strength calculator, perfect for checking how strong your own concoctions (such as punches) are. 

To use the calculator, just enter the ingredients one by one; the calculator will show the strength and volume of the resulting mixture. 

You can use this also to calculate the strength of a drink that you are customizing; this will only set the strength of the drink, though, so remember to also check the volume of the drink and add a corresponding size to the drink you are creating.

Here you can set your preferences. Your gender and weight are used to calculate your blood alcohol content (BAC) and the time it takes for you to become sober again. 

You can also change the interface language from this page. If you change the language, completely exit jAlcoMeter to apply the changes to the main screen also. Please note that if you have created drinks (or if you have initialized the drink library), the drink names and sizes will remain as they are. You can manually re-initialize the drink library from the drink category selection screen; this will create drinks based on the currently selected language. 

Note on the day changing time: drinks that are consumed before this time (in the morning) will appear on the previous day's drink history. This is so that drinks consumed after midnight are shown together with the drinks consumed during the evening. The default value should be reasonable, but feel free to change it as you like. This setting only affects how the drinks are shown to you; all the drinks are stored using their actual consumption times.

You can customize the drink details from here. To customize the drink size, click on the check box to be able to enter values manually. \n\nYou can use the drink calculator to calculate the drink strength (see the calculator icon next to the strength edit box). This only sets the drink\'s strength, you must still set the drink\'s size manually.

Here you can select the drink category. Below the categories are shown the five latest drinks you have drunk for quick access. 

Click on the options menu to add new drink categories, and to (re-)initialize the drink library. Note: if you have changed the interface language, the drink names will remain as they are. Use the drink library re-initialization to obtain new names with correct language. Second note: this will also remove all the drinks you have created yourself! 

You can long click on the category names to modify the category information. In general, the entire drink library is customizable, so just long click on the icons or use the menu button to customize the drink library.

This page shows statistics on your entire recorded drinking history. On the first tab you can see a summary of the entire recorded drinking history, and on the other tabs you can browse your yearly, monthly, and weekly drinking habits.

Here you can browse all the drinks you have ever recorded to jAlcoMeter. You can also add new drinks to past dates if you have forgotten something, and you can edit the history if you have made mistakes when marking drinks.
